channel.title: Ports on Thoughts
channel.description: Recent content in Ports on Thoughts

item.title: India China container port rank 2018
item.description: Task was to extract data from an html table and arrange it in a way to provide small conclusions from data. In this example sought to gain a sense of where India’s ports stand relative to world ports in terms of container thoughput. The ranking shows that India’s ports have some way to go to catch up with the throughput by many of China’s ports. After finding sample data from https://www.

item.title: Top 50 port throughput by country
item.description: Table of container throughout for top 50 ports sorted and ordered. The table provides additional history of container port throughput by country. Data is drawn from http://www.worldshipping.org/ by way of a google search into excel. Several modifications to data were made in excel. And then flat file in csv form was imported into R. Within R the data was sorted and tabulated. The value added to the data from the website was in ranking the data by 2018 column, splitting out port from country, filtering out records for China and India from the broader set of 50 top container ports.
